data.title: Fix TypeScript decl
'atomic component' can also be used to signal a component
Added JSBHaxe class to create haxe definitions.
data.body:
For haxe library look at: https://github.com/rsredsq/atomic-haxe
Check examples folders.

data.title: Resurrect and refactor gamepad script support
Create a simple 3D vehicle physics demo
Git ignore generated *.d.ts (Atomic.d.ts, ToolCore.d.ts, Editor.d.ts)
Rakefile, ignores, defines and errors
data.body:
-Windows build in rakefile ensures VS tools are on path, and prevents ATOMIC_DEV_BUILD from being set so resource paths work correctly
-Cache and compiled shaders excluded from git
-Typescript definitions updated from latest build-these should actually probably be ignored instead
-Added a typescript definitions file for items not automatically generated by JSBind
-More detail added to errors logged when loading plugins
-Debug to the debugger console when debugger is attached

data.title: JSComponent in inspector should display component title
data.body: Instead of the drawer in the inspector being titled "JSComponent", it seems like it should display either the full path or just the bare filename of the component file it references.  Maybe: "Enemy (js)" or "JSComponent - Enemy". If you get multiple JSComponents attached to a node, you don't know which is which when the drawers are closed.

data.title: "atomic component" line should also be recognized as 'atomic component'
data.body:
when using 'atomic component' instead of "atomic component", the .asset file is saved with "isComponentFile":false

Any format of javascript string should be usable.

data.title: node.createJSComponent require .js extension on path to component, make it optional
Fix for inspector transform editing
Test-CI2
Commit to fix CI with
Scripted ResourceRef inspector fields
Unify ResourceRef databinding where possible, instead of custom ComponentInspector fields
RigidBody2D/CollisionShape2D are order dependent on node, RigidBody2D must exist first
data.body: They should not be order dependent

data.title: Missing prefs crashes editor, as does empty json (OSX, probably windows too)
Editor crash when quickly opened and then closed
data.body:
Got a crash, when I opened an Editor, and then closed it very quickly(about 2 sec after I run it).
Seem's like it's curl error, maybe editor isn't get or sended a request to server for license data, and then curl connection hasn't closed correctly.
Seem's like Editor Cache should be cleared to reproduce it ;)
Stack trace:

```
    AtomicEditor.exe!Curl_schannel_shutdown(connectdata * conn, int sockindex)Строка 1131 C
    AtomicEditor.exe!Curl_ssl_shutdown(connectdata * conn, int sockindex)Строка 513   C
    AtomicEditor.exe!Curl_schannel_close(connectdata * conn, int sockindex)Строка 1104    C
    AtomicEditor.exe!Curl_ssl_close(connectdata * conn, int sockindex)Строка 508  C
    AtomicEditor.exe!Curl_disconnect(connectdata * conn, bool dead_connection)Строка 2727 C
    AtomicEditor.exe!Curl_done(connectdata * * connp, CURLcode status, bool premature)Строка 5988 C
    AtomicEditor.exe!multi_runsingle(Curl_multi * multi, timeval now, SessionHandle * data)Строка 1247    C
    AtomicEditor.exe!curl_multi_perform(void * multi_handle, int * running_handles)Строка 1802    C
    AtomicEditor.exe!easy_transfer(void * multi)Строка 717    C
    AtomicEditor.exe!easy_perform(SessionHandle * data, bool events)Строка 805    C
    AtomicEditor.exe!curl_easy_perform(void * easy)Строка 824 C
    AtomicEditor.exe!ToolCore::CurlRequest::ThreadFunction()Строка 42 C++
>   AtomicEditor.exe!Atomic::ThreadFunctionStatic(void * data)Строка 43   C++
```

data.title: TestCI Fail
setInterval, setTimeout functions
data.body: Just need a realisation of `setInterval`, `setTimeout` functions. Take look at here: https://github.com/svaarala/duktape/tree/master/examples/eventloop

data.title: Fix for node name when dragging model directly
Prefab Improvements
Miscellaneous editor feedback and usability issues
data.body:
so. rather than post everything in gitter for suggestions and not put it in my own list of wishes - this is better. these are just my own thoughts about what i would like to see. im not begging for these, these are just my views on what would be cool for atomic.
these are either cosmetic or actual features of use
i am using the repo version also, if you are wondering ;)

• after running a project. a window pops up saying what has happened. this should go into console instead.
• key layouts other than QWERTY need to be addressed. such as the camera/scene movement. you can move the camera with WASD, but for others without a QWERTY layout, this is problematic. arrow keys instead?
• to be able to minimive/maximize views, such as the sidebars and move things to your liking
• saves your layout
• to be able to make text in the editor bigger/smaller
• move the top bar 'play' options away and put them either next to the actual top bar, next to file-edit etc. or above the 'project' name on the top left, or put it to the top right above 'inspector'. this leaves room for the tabs to move up and take that space, giving more for scene view
• take away the cartoony tick boxes in the inspector. they are out of sync with atomic. i would go for a blue/color box that lights when on, grey when off. a bit like the dropdown markers in inspector
• also the cartoony 'x' for closing files are out of place. plus are a little hard to see. 

i had some more. but really thats good for now.
ill add as and when i think of them. but something just thats on my mind when i first use atomic

howdy,

this is just to show the new platformer from the github repo of examples performs at a very slow rate. seems fine in the public release. but just to say about really. here is a gif recording it
